body:
Moran was the son of famous marine painter, Edward Moran, who in turn was the older brother of renowned U.S. Geological Survey western expedition landscape chronicler, Thomas Moran.  He began his art studies under his famous father and later trained at the National Academy of Design (New York City).  His subjects varied widely and included birds, garden scenes, portraits, landscapes, military genre.  Moran exhibited widelyâWorld's Columbian Exhibition (1892-1893), American Water Color Society, Society of Independent Artists, National Academy of Design, Boston Art Club, Brooklyn Art Association, Art Institute of Chicago, and the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts.

High auction record for this artist is $9,400.
dimensions: Oil on canvas, 15.5 x 11.5 inches / Signed lower right
metaDescription: Moran was the son of famous marine painter, Edward Moran, who in turn was the older brother of renowned U.S. Geological Survey western expedition landscape chronicle
metaTitle: Leon Moran Painting - Crossing the Creek - 19th Century American Fine Art
title: Crossing the Creek
